alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 1:42PM CDT until June 03 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-030645- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0006.000000T0000Z-220604T0130Z/ /BRIO2.2.ER.220602T0642Z.220603T0000Z.220603T1930Z.NO/ 142 PM CDT Thu Jun 2 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Flood plain fields at higher elevations away from the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County may see flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/22/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
